school_name: College of Staten Island (CUNY - Staten Island)
tag_professor: Participation matters (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Caring (3)  Amazing lectures (2)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Inspirational (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Best professor I\'ve ever had. She really cares about the material and makes Chinese as easy as possible. Being a student in her class was a complete joy. Would most definitely recommend her as a professor.

school_name: College of Staten Island (CUNY - Staten Island)
tag_professor: Participation matters (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Caring (3)  Amazing lectures (2)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Inspirational (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: Ping Shi is one of the best professors I\'ve had at CSI. She\'s very clear with everything she teaches. I\'m not gonna say it\'s an easy class because learning a new language is normally hard, but she makes it easy to understand and enjoyable. She motivated me to move on to CHN114! There are 7 HW and 7 Quizzes, 1 after each textbook chapter.

school_name: College of Staten Island (CUNY - Staten Island)
tag_professor: Participation matters (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Caring (3)  Amazing lectures (2)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Inspirational (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
stu_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS  RESPECTED  CARING
comments: When I first joined Ping Shi\'s Chinese class, I was skeptical but by the second class things went very well. She\'s patient, caring and doesn\'t mind stopping her lesson to personally help you. I thought Chinese would be hell for me, but it\'s actually exciting in her class. Recommended 100 % :D

school_name: College of Staten Island (CUNY - Staten Island)
tag_professor: Participation matters (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Caring (3)  Amazing lectures (2)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Inspirational (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
comments: A very nice Chinese lady and respects her students. She talks very slow with Chinese accent but you would be able to understand what she\'s trying to explain. There are 7 quizzes in total and aren\'t hard if you study well. She is expecting you to do the homework and you should not take this class if you don\'t want to put any efforts.

school_name: College of Staten Island (CUNY - Staten Island)
tag_professor: Participation matters (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Caring (3)  Amazing lectures (2)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Inspirational (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: This professor is amazing. You have to work hard for your grade so if you\'re in this course for an easy A I suggest you look elsewhere. Chinese is a hard language to learn but she makes the quizzes and tests a little easier for you by having a review sheet and they are almost exactly similar. There is a quiz for every chapter and two tests just FYI

school_name: College of Staten Island (CUNY - Staten Island)
tag_professor: Participation matters (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Caring (3)  Amazing lectures (2)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Inspirational (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: If you\'re in her class for an Easy A, I suggest you to work for your grade. There are quizzes for every chapter, 1 Midterm(ORAL&EXAM), 1 Final(ORAL&EXAM), 1 Presentation. Participation/Attendance is Mandatory. She\'s a very nice lady, well- respected from students. Don\'t take this class if you\'re not interested in learning Chinese. GOOD LUCK

school_name: College of Staten Island (CUNY - Staten Island)
tag_professor: Participation matters (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Gives good feedback (3)  Caring (3)  Amazing lectures (2)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Inspirational (1)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)
stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  PARTICIPATION MATTERS  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: She\'s very nice, but don\'t take her for granted if you\'ve previously taken CHN 112/213. There\'s a quiz for every chapter you\'ve done with her, 1 Midterm, 1 Final, and 1 Presentation. If you do need help, you can email her questions about issues related to her field. Good luck :) E-Textbooks are online, she prefers you to have the book in hand.

comments: The Greatest Mandarin Professor at CSI. She knows her native language well and she explains it the best. She understands that learning a new language is hard, especially mandarin, her native language and she goes slow to help students learn. I love her teaching style and kindness.
